category.title: Introduction to the ARP and Spouse and Family Programs
category.subtitle: Videos: 4

item.title: What is the 12 Step Program?
item.description: A brief introduction to the 12-step addiction recovery program.

item.title: What to Expect at a 12 Step Recovery Meeting
item.description: This video will help you understand what to expect when you attend a 12-step meeting for the first time.

item.title: What to Expect at a Spouse and Family Support Meeting
item.description: This video will help you understand what to expect when you attend a spouse and family support meeting for the first time.

item.title: What is the Spouse and Family Support Program?
item.description: A brief introduction to the spouse and family support meeting.

item.title: What I Know Now: Spouses
item.description: Spouses write a letter to their younger selves concerning what they wish they had known about their loved ones addiction.

item.title: What I Know Now: Parents
item.description: Parents write a letter to their younger selves concerning what they wish they had known about their childs addiction.

category.title: Bible Videos - The Life of Jesus Christ
category.subtitle: Videos: 1

item.title: Calming the Tempest
item.description: The disciples' faith is tested before Jesus calms the stormy sea.

item.title: How Firm a Foundation
item.description: November 2, 2014: Elder Donald L. Hallstrom teaches how the solid foundation of the gospel will enable us to overcome any challenges encountered in life.

item.title: RootsTech 2015: Healings Familes
item.description: Mandy Phillips accepts Elder Andersen's temple challenge and is reunited with her grandparents she hasn't seen in 20 years.

item.title: Consultant Training - Different People, Different Trees: Teaching to Individual Needs
item.description: Learn how to identify the most common tree situations.

item.title: Teaching Family History in Your Home, Class or Quorum
item.description: In this session you will learn about resources and methods for teaching family history.

item.title: Consultant Training: Using FamilySearch Partners
item.description: Hasten your family history woork through FamilySearch partners.

item.title: FamilySearch Family Tree 2014 and Beyond
item.description: This class will give an update on the current status of Family Tree and its latest features.

item.title: FamilySearch Indexing: It's a Whole New World!
item.description: An overview of the powerful new features and volunteer opportunities in the new indexing program.

item.title: What's New at FamilySearch
item.description: What are the latest tools from FamilySearch, and how do I use them?

item.title: From Tree to Temple: Preparing Family Names for the Temple
item.description: This class will help you prepare an ancestor's name for temple ordinances.

item.title: She Wanted Me to Find Her
item.description: A new family history consultant shares her experience of finding her ancestor's name and going to the temple.

item.title: RootsTech 2015: Sharing the Temple Challenge
item.description: After accepting and accomplishing the temple challenge, Lauren Hatch teaches her family what she learned.

item.title: Sam Hepworth Mission Prep Video
item.description: Accepting Elder Neil L. Andersen’s temple challenge and sharing it with others helped Sam Hepworth prepare for his mission.

item.title: RootsTech 2015: Healings Familes
item.description: Mandy Phillips accepts Elder Andersen's temple challenge and is reunited with her grandparents she hasn't seen in 20 years.

item.title: Sharing the Temple Challenge
item.description: Elder Andersen talks about the many blessings and promises that come from accepting the challenge to find and take a name of one of your own ancestors to the temple.

item.title: She Wanted Me to Find Her
item.description: A new family history consultant shares her experience of finding her ancestor's name and going to the temple.

item.title: How To Navigate the Family Tree Tool Overview
item.description: Walk through video on the basics of Family Tree. Includes navigation, view types overview and descriptions of items on Family Tree.

item.title: How To Find Your Ancestors In Your Family Tree
item.description: Walk through video on how to use the descendancy view to find ancestors.

item.title: How To Add Photos to Your Family Tree
item.description: Walk through on how to use the Memories in Family Tree to Add photos and stories.

item.title: Share Reserved Ordinances with Family and Friends
item.description: Demonstration of steps to share a reserved name in FamilySearch.org with another family member.

item.title: Video Presentation: The Family Is Ordained of God
item.description: Women from around the world testify of the blessings of the family in God’s plan.

item.title: Find Answers to Your Questions
item.description: We can prepare for general conference by pondering questions. Guidance and direction will come as we listen to the messages of living prophets.

item.title: Highlight: The Family is of God
item.description: Highlight: Sister Carole M. Stephens' address at the April 2015 General Conference.

item.title: Highlight: Filling Our Homes with Light and Truth
item.description: Highlight: Sister Cheryl A. Esplin's address at the April 2015 General Conference.

item.title: Highlight: Defenders of the Proclamation
item.description: Highlight: Sister Bonnie L. Oscarson's address at the April 2015 General Conference.

item.title: Highlight: The Comforter
item.description: Highlight: President Henry B. Eyring's address at the April 2015 General Conference.

item.title: Find Answers to Your Questions
item.description: We can prepare for general conference by pondering questions. Guidance and direction will come as we listen to the messages of living prophets.

item.title: The Blessings of General Conference
item.description: Decide now to make general conference a priority in your life. Decide to listen carefully and follow the teachings that are given.

item.title: General Conference: Strengthening Faith and Testimony
item.description: Robert D. Hale's talk given at the 2013 General Conference Saturday Morning Session

item.title: Seek, Receive, Act
item.description: General conference gives us the opportunity to seek, receive, and act on personal revelation. We can receive inspired guidance to help us grow and become who Heavenly Father needs us to be.

item.title: Christine
item.description: Christine was struggling with one particular challenge, but when she heard President Uchtdorf speak at general conference, she made a commitment that would scare most of us.

item.title: Ryan
item.description: Ryan is a busy dad with active kids, who need his attention. Since general conference, he's changed his focus from screen time to family time. How have your priorities shifted in the past month?

item.title: Walter
item.description: Walter needed one message from #LDSconf and he received it. Now he's changing as a result.

item.title: Ruth
item.description: This mom wanted just one question answered when she watched general conference. Because of what she heard, her kids are now praying for peanut butter cookies and she's glad.

item.title: Obedience to the Ten Commandments
item.description: As children of God, we have been given the wonderful gift of choice. The truest happiness and peace we can have comes by choosing to obey His laws.

item.title: Family History: What I Found
item.description: Joe always loved his grandfather, but he didn’t know some of the most interesting things about him until a mysterious journal entry and a surprising wartime keepsake inspired Joe to learn more.

item.title: Protect Our Nestlings
item.description: We live in a very dangerous world that threatens those things that are most spiritual. The family is under attack from forces seen and unseen. We need to live in such a way that the adversary cannot steal into our homes.

item.title: The Refiner's Fire
item.description: The refiner’s fire is not a comfortable place to be. It involves intense heat and repeated hammering. But it is in the refiner’s fire we are purified and prepared to meet God.

item.title: Finding the Incredible: What Cancer and Trials Can Teach Us
item.description: Daniel and Melanie Hedlund found out Daniel had cancer in December 2007, three weeks after being married.

item.title: I Know That My Savior Loves Me
item.description: I Know That My Savior Loves Me

item.title: When Jesus Christ Was Baptized
item.description: "When Jesus Christ was Baptized", I Can Play It Music video.

item.title: Holding Hands Around the World
item.description: Holding Hands Around the World

item.title: One in a Million Video
item.description: One in a Million Video

item.title: Love Enough
item.description: Love Enough

item.title: The Nativity
item.description: Music Video

item.title: My Covenant Path
item.description: My Covenant Path

item.title: Our Time to Shine
item.description: Music Video

item.title: I'm Trying to Be like Jesus
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir performs "I'm Trying to Be Like Jesus".

item.title: Baptism
item.description: Primary Song, Baptism

item.title: I Often Go Walking
item.description: Friend, Simplified, music, I Can Play it

item.title: The Family Is of God
item.description: Friend, Simplified, music, I Can Play it

item.title: He Sent His Son
item.description: Friend, Simplified, music, I Can Play it

item.title: God's Christmas Gift
item.description: Friend, Simplified, music, I Can Play it

item.title: I Hope They Call Me on a Mission
item.description: Friend, Simplified, music, I Can Play it

item.title: I Will Follow God's Plan for Me
item.description: Friend, Simplified, music, I Can Play it

item.title: Through Your Eyes
item.description: Friend, Simplified, music, I Can Play it

item.title: President Monson - Great Expectations
item.description: Prophets and Apostles speak about our divine potential as children of God.

item.title: Seek, Receive, Act
item.description: General conference gives us the opportunity to seek, receive, and act on personal revelation. We can receive inspired guidance to help us grow and become who Heavenly Father needs us to be.

item.title: Christine
item.description: Christine was struggling with one particular challenge, but when she heard President Uchtdorf speak at general conference, she made a commitment that would scare most of us.

item.title: Ryan
item.description: Ryan is a busy dad with active kids, who need his attention. Since general conference, he's changed his focus from screen time to family time. How have your priorities shifted in the past month?

item.title: Walter
item.description: Walter needed one message from #LDSconf and he received it. Now he's changing as a result.

item.title: Ruth
item.description: This mom wanted just one question answered when she watched general conference. Because of what she heard, her kids are now praying for peanut butter cookies and she's glad.

item.title: Finding Forgiveness in Our Hearts
item.description: If we can find forgiveness in our hearts for those who have caused us hurt and injury, we will rise to a higher level of self-esteem and well-being.

item.title: The Savior Removes Guilt
item.description: Through the Atonement of Jesus Christ we can be forgiven of our sins.

item.title: Preparing for the Second Coming
item.description: We prepare ourselves for the Savior’s return as we “stand … in holy places.”

item.title: Helping People Help Themselves
item.description: The Lord’s way of caring for the poor consists of teaching correct principles so they can lift themselves from poverty to self-reliance.

item.title: Beware of Murmuring
item.description: We must beware of murmuring against the Lord’s commandments because murmuring can lead to disobedience.

item.title: Caring for the Needy
item.description: The Lord’s way of caring for the needy is different from the world’s way.

item.title: Establishing Zion
item.description: We need to adopt the character, attributes, and faithfulness of those who lived in Zion if we are to establish Zion in our homes, branches, wards, and stakes.

item.title: The Aaronic Priesthood and the Ministering of Angels
item.description: The ordinances of the Aaronic priesthood are vital to the ministering of angels.

item.title: Succession in the First Presidency
item.description: By divine design, when the President of the Church dies, the First Presidency is dissolved and the Quorum of the Twelve automatically becomes the presiding body of the Church.

item.title: Sustaining Those Who Serve
item.description: For us to sustain those who have been called, we must examine our lives, repent as necessary, pledge to keep the Lord’s commandments, and follow His servants.

item.title: The Lord Measures the Heart
item.description: Ultimately we will be judged not only for our actions, but also for the desires of our hearts.

item.title: Patriarchal Blessings—A Personal Liahona
item.description: A patriarchal blessing literally contains chapters from your book of eternal possibilities.

item.title: Ordinary Latter-day Saints
item.description: President Boyd K. Packer describes how he felt as he witnessed the power of faith in the lives of a family in the Philippines.

item.title: Do The Best We Can
item.description: Oliver Granger is remembered for what he was more than for what he accomplished.

item.title: The Importance of a Name
item.description: Elder M. Russell Ballard explains how the name of the Church describes what the Church is.

item.title: Light in Their Eyes
item.description: Because of a young woman’s goodness, an older woman’s life was changed.

item.title: Your Witness of the Prophet Joseph Smith
item.description: A personal testimony of the Prophet Joseph Smith will prepare you to help others who are seeking the truth.

item.title: The Prophet of the Restoration
item.description: Joseph Smith was the instrument in God’s hands in bringing forth sacred scripture, lost doctrine, and the restoration of the priesthood.

item.title: Jesus Christ Understands Our Suffering
item.description: The Savior understands our suffering because of His suffering to accomplish the Atonement. Our difficult experiences can also help increase understanding and compassion for others.

item.title: Enduring Testing
item.description: Elder Robert D. Hales recounts experiences of waiting upon the Lord as he learned lessons through physical pain, mental anguish, and pondering.

item.title: Our Hardest Times Bring Growth and Happiness
item.description: Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin relates how his mother taught him to respond to adversity.

item.title: Called and Chosen
item.description: Priesthood holders must live righteously to be chosen by God.

item.title: "The Powers of Heaven"
item.description: (D&C 121:34-46) The components and processes involved in providing electricity to a home are compared to the principles the Lord outlined in section 121 for those who would exercise His priesthood in power.

item.title: Finding the Incredible: What Cancer and Trials Can Teach Us
item.description: Daniel and Melanie Hedlund found out Daniel had cancer in December 2007, three weeks after being married.

item.title: Joy in Families
item.description: The greatest joys in this life center in families, as they will in the worlds to come.

item.title: Angels Are God’s Emissaries
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland describes the purpose and the ministry of angels.

item.title: For All Eternity
item.description: Elder Enrique Falabella describes the sacrifices he and his wife made to be married for eternity.

item.title: Love of Learning
item.description: Learning all we can is a necessary part of our life on earth.

item.title: Knowledge of God and Jesus Christ
item.description: We need to know about Heavenly Father and Jesus Christ to be saved.

item.title: Mankind’s Three Great Rights
item.description: We believe that governments should allow citizens rights of life, liberty, and property.

item.title: Joseph and Hyrum’s Testimony of the Book of Mormon
item.description: Joseph and Hyrum Smith’s actions in Carthage Jail provide a testimony of the truthfulness of the Book of Mormon.

item.title: Our Responsibility Toward Government
item.description: We are commanded to uphold wise leaders and use our influence in the process of making and administering laws.

item.title: You Are Needed in the Lord’s Service
item.description: The spreading of the gospel throughout the earth is a sign of the coming of the Lord. You are needed in His service.

item.title: We Can Live the Lord’s Standards
item.description: We can resist the wickedness that surrounds us and become like those who lived in Zion.

item.title: Help Prepare for the Second Coming
item.description: The world is being prepared for the Second Coming because of the Lord’s work through His missionaries.

item.title: Joseph Smith—Prophet of the Restoration
item.description: (D&C 135) This review of the Prophet Joseph Smith's ministry shows that he "has done more, save Jesus only, for the salvation of men in this world."

item.title: The President of the Church
item.description: The senior Apostle becomes President of the Church when the First Presidency is reorganized.

item.title: Living the Gospel
item.description: We don't achieve spiritual progress in large increments all at once. It comes gradually and slowly. It requires patience and persistence. The council I would give, the observation I would make is; consistency in small things brings great blessings.

item.title: He Lives - Celebrate Easter Because Jesus Christ Lives
item.description: Because of the Resurrection, Jesus Christ lives. Because of Him, you can overcome sin and experience everlasting joy. Learn more about how you can discover, embrace, and share the joy of the Resurrection at helives.mormon.org.

item.title: He is Risen: John the Beloved's Witness of the Resurrection
item.description: The Apostle John provides his eyewitness account of the last events in the Savior's life and his Resurrection.

item.title: The Miracle of the Atonement
item.description: There is no sin or transgression, pain or sorrow, which is outside of the healing power of His Atonement.

item.title: I Know That My Redeemer Lives
item.description: The choir and congregation sing “I Know That My Redeemer Lives.”

item.title: He Lives: Testimonies of Jesus Christ
item.description: See and hear modern-day Apostles testify that Jesus Christ is the Savior and that He lives today.

item.title: My Redeemer Lives
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “My Redeemer Lives.”

item.title: For God So Loved the World
item.description: Give thanks for the Lord Jesus Christ: His life, His atoning sacrifice, and His resurrection.

item.title: Protect Our Nestlings
item.description: We live in a very dangerous world that threatens those things that are most spiritual. The family is under attack from forces seen and unseen. We need to live in such a way that the adversary cannot steal into our homes.

item.title: Seek, Receive, Act
item.description: General conference gives us the opportunity to seek, receive, and act on personal revelation. We can receive inspired guidance to help us grow and become who Heavenly Father needs us to be.

item.description: Christine was struggling with one particular challenge, but when she heard President Uchtdorf speak at general conference, she made a commitment that would scare most of us.

item.description: This mom wanted just one question answered when she watched general conference. Because of what she heard, her kids are now praying for peanut butter cookies and she's glad.

item.title: A New Light About Him
item.description: Deseret Industries, a branch of the Church welfare program, provides mentoring and coaching to those who struggle to find meaningful employment.

item.title: DI Helps People Discover Opportunities
item.description: DI helps people find where their strengths and weaknesses are and helps guide them in directions they may not have considered before.

item.title: DI Helps People Overcome Personal Trials
item.description: DI helps a woman recognize her abilities and overcome anxieties.

item.title: Texting Truth
item.description: A group of young men share how they use text-messaging to learn scriptures and uplift each other. Elder Scott describes ways we can use text messaging, phones, and more to draw closer to Christ, strengthen others, and increase our gospel knowledge.
